name: Seekers of Life
description: As the Discovery's history becomes public knowledge, the anti-synthetic movement is reborn! Can you protect synthetics from immediate harm and begin to find a way to combat this movement?
rules:
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Borg, Augment, or Dominion Faction Missions in one Phase, and Ship Battles in another Phase.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battles and Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Elnor, Seven, Tyler, Cyberneticists, or Soji will provide a bonus to Ship Battles and Faction Missions.
-- Using The Artifact, Borg Sphere 878, or Jem'Hadar Battleship will provide a hull bonus in Skirmish Battles.
-- Every Ship Battle or Faction Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Elnor, Seven, Tyler, Cyberneticists or Soji
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

action.name: The Light, It Is Almost Like Music

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Seven
rewards.flavor: After being severed from the Borg Collective, Seven of Nine—now called Seven—struggled to adapt.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "To know that I will endure a horrific accident that kills my husband and nearly kills me is bad enough. But then to learn that I'll go on to be controlled by a rogue AI that nearly wipes out all organic life... synthetics are just too dangerous. Join me in banning them."

"No one in Airiam's new movement has thought through the logistics. With everyone at risk of disappearing via temporal anomaly at any time, we're all relying on synthetics to keep the lights on. Banning them would cripple the Federation."
"I am glad to hear how useful we are. Synthetics are also people who deserve the chance to live, not get captured or chopped up in some rush to prosecution or black market."
"Tyler's choice of words was thoughtless. Seven is angry with him, as am I. We will channel our aggression into protecting synthetics. Please, Captain, choose to help us."

"To know that I will endure a horrific accident that kills my husband and nearly kills me is bad enough. But then to learn that I'll go on to be controlled by a rogue AI that nearly wipes out all organic life... synthetics are just too dangerous. Join me in banning them."

"No one in Airiam's new movement has thought through the logistics. With everyone at risk of disappearing via temporal anomaly at any time, we're all relying on synthetics to keep the lights on. Banning them would cripple the Federation."
"I am glad to hear how useful we are. Synthetics are also people who deserve the chance to live, not get captured or chopped up in some rush to prosecution or black market."
"Tyler's choice of words was thoughtless. Seven is angry with him, as am I. We will channel our aggression into protecting synthetics. Please, Captain, choose to help us."
